FuncDef:
The radius-attribute policy-name no-exist-policy command configures a policy for access users if the policy name carried in the HUAWEI-95 attribute delivered by the RADIUS server does not exist.
undo radius-attribute policy-name no-exist-policy command restores the default configuration.
By default, access users are forced offline if the policy name carried in the HUAWEI-95 attribute delivered by the RADIUS server does not exist.

ParaDef.Info:
Allows users online if the policy name carried in the HUAWEI-95 attribute delivered by the RADIUS server does not exist.
-

Forces users offline if the policy name carried in the HUAWEI-95 attribute delivered by the RADIUS server does not exist.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To determine whether access users are allowed online or offline if the policy name carried in the HUAWEI-95 attribute delivered by the RADIUS server does not exist, run the radius-attribute policy-name no-exist-policy command.
Configuration Impact
If the radius-attribute policy-name no-exist-policy online command is run and the policy name carried in the HUAWEI-95 attribute delivered by the RADIUS server does not exist on the NE40E, users are allowed online, and the policy configured for the domain takes effect.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
After the radius-attribute hw-policy-name support-type edsg command is run, the radius-attribute policy-name no-exist-policy offline command configuration does not take effect for EDSG services.
